Hi, the `poll_sensors()` call blocks the simulation and you are running it continuously in a loop, so it may look like the simulator is lagging. Try to add some delay between the calls, for example using `time.sleep`, so they don't happen so often. Also, after the vehicle passes, you can stop polling the sensors.

```python
import time
tForBegin = []
while True:
    timeLocalList = []
    veh_cont.poll_sensors()
    sensors = veh_cont.sensors

    veh_auto.poll_sensors()
    sensors1 = veh_auto.sensors

    veh_auto2.poll_sensors()
    sensors2 = veh_auto2.sensors

    pos0 = veh_cont.state['pos']

    timeNow = sensors['timer'].data['time']

    if pos0[1] < -4040:
        tForBegin.append(timeNow)
        script1 = getAiScript(posAuto,tForBegin[0])
        veh_auto.ai_set_script(script1)
        script2 = getAiScript(posAuto2,tForBegin[0])
        veh_auto2.ai_set_script(script2)
        break # stop polling sensors when the vehicle passed the location
    time.sleep(0.1) # add delay so `poll_sensors` is not called continuously

input('Press Enter to exit...')
```

You can find information about the vehicle script here: https://beamngpy.readthedocs.io/en/latest/beamngpy.html#beamngpy.vehicle.Vehicle.ai_set_script

It is a list of `(x, y, z, t)` nodes, where `x, y, z` specify the desired location of the vehicle at time `t` (in seconds).
